citeinfo.title: EnviroAtlas - 303(d) Impairments by 12-digit HUC for the Conterminous United States

pubinfo.publish: U.S. EPA Office of Research & Development (ORD) - National Exposure Research Laboratory (NERL)

idinfo.useconst: None. Please check sources, scale, accuracy, currency and other available information. Please confirm that you are using the most recent copy of both data and metadata. Acknowledgement of the EPA would be appreciated.

descript.abstract:
This EnviroAtlas dataset depicts the total length of stream or river flowlines that have impairments submitted to the EPA by states under section 303(d) of the Clean Water Act. It also contains the total lengths of streams, rivers, and canals, total waterbody area, and stream density (stream length per area) from the US Geological Survey's high-resolution National Hydrography Dataset (NHD).
This dataset was produced by the US EPA to support research and online mapping activities related to EnviroAtlas. EnviroAtlas (https://www.epa.gov/enviroatlas) allows the user to interact with a web-based, easy-to-use, mapping application to view and analyze multiple ecosystem services for the contiguous United States. The dataset is available as downloadable data (https://edg.epa.gov/data/Public/ORD/EnviroAtlas) or as an EnviroAtlas map service. Additional descriptive information about each attribute in this dataset can be found in its associated EnviroAtlas Fact Sheet (https://www.epa.gov/enviroatlas/enviroatlas-fact-sheets).
descript.purpose: This dataset shows the lengths of streams with and without impairments, the density of total streams, and the area of waterbodies by HUC12. Users can use this data to assess the type and extent of impairments in their watersheds. This information could be used to target watersheds in need of Best Management Practices (BMPs) to reduce non-point source pollution, or to develop remediation strategies that address common sources of impairments in a watershed. Stream length, density, and area could be used to study water supply. Users can also view this information along with other layers. For example, layers from this dataset could be overlaid with layers on impervious surface or riparian buffers, to identify possible sources of impairments and remediation needs, or combined with recreation layers to see where impairments could impact recreational use of waters. The overall goal of EnviroAtlas is to employ and develop the best available science to map indicators of ecosystem services production, demand, and drivers for the nation.
descript.supplinf:
Due to differences in how streams were recorded in the maps used to develop the NHD, stream length and stream density vary in some regions due to overcounting or undercounting of streams. Stream length and density should be taken as approximations.
While most features in the 303(d) impairments list are coded onto NHD features, there are some custom data that are not associated with NHD; the NHD and 303(d) datasets do not always align. Therefore, in some 12-digit HUCs, the length of 303(d) impaired segments may exceed the length of segments recorded in the NHD dataset.
In addition, the data on impairments only represent waters on a state's approved 303(d) list, and not all impaired water bodies. The extent of monitoring and the methods used vary from state to state. The 303(d) list does not include impaired waters with an established TMDL (Total Maximum Daily Load), impaired waters for which other pollution control mechanisms are in place and expected to attain water quality standards, or waters with impairments that are not result of pollution. Additionally, the data are for whatever year each state last submitted its list of impaired waters to the EPA; these data are not all from the same year.
Finally, the same stream segment may have multiple impairments. Therefore, summing the stream lengths for all impairments in a HUC may result in a number that is greater than the value for TotImpLen.

cntperp.cntorg: U.S. Environmental Protection Agency, Office of Research and Development-Sustainable and Healthy Communities Research Program, EnviroAtlas

dataqual.logic: Tests for integrity have not been performed.
dataqual.complete: Features represented have not been tested for completeness

horizpa.horizpar: Data were collected using methods that have unknown accuracy (EPA National Geospatial Data Policy [NGDP] Accuracy Tier 10). For more information, please see EPA's NGDP at https://epa.gov/geospatial/policies.html

procstep.procdesc: 1. Calculate the length of impaired waters by cause.
1.a. Obtained May 1, 2015 303(d) Listed Impaired Waters NHD Indexed Dataset from https://www.epa.gov/waterdata/waters-geospatial-data-downloads#303dListedImpairedWaters.

1.b. Dissolve rad_303d_l (Reach Address Database - feature class showing impaired reaches from the 303(d) Listed Impaired Waters NHD Indexed Dataset) on ESRI_key (convenience key provided to aid in joins and relates in ESRI software).

1.c. Identify impaired stream reaches for each category of impairment causes; the categories consist of groups of parent causes from attgeo_303dcaussrce (table of 303(d) Listed Impaired Waters by Causes of Impairment and Probable Sources from 303(d) Listed Impaired Waters NHD Indexed Dataset). See the overview section of the metadata for details on categories used.
1.d. Relate attgeo_303dcaussrce to rad_303d_l using the field ESRI_key.

1.e. Select reaches with impairment causes included in each EnviroAtlas impairment category. Select from attgeo_303dcaussrce where LW_PARENT_CAUSE_NAME (cause of impairment group name such as 'Pathogens' or 'Sediment') = "CAUSE" and select Related Tables to select all reaches with a given impairment cause. Export selected features, and dissolve them to prevent double-counting of streams with more than one impairment.

1.d. For each category of impairment causes, find the total length of impaired streams in each HUC12. Intersect each dissolved feature class from the previous step with the NHDPlusV2_WBDSnapshot_EnviroAtlas_CONUS. Add the field "KM", calculate the length in kilometers, then summarize on the HUC_12 field, with the sum of "KM" as a summary statistic. The output will be a table for each impairment category containing the total length of all impaired streams by HUC12.
2. Calculate the total waterbody area, total stream length, and stream density by HUC12.
2.a. Obtain the high-resolution NHD datasets, by state, from the USGS (ftp://rockyftp.cr.usgs.gov/vdelivery/Datasets/Staged/Hydrography/NHD/State/HighResolution).
2.b. Merge NHDWaterbody shapefiles for all states, then use the Delete Identical tool to eliminate duplicated lines that were created by the merge. Repeat with NHDFlowline and NHDArea shapefiles.

2.c. Find the total area of all waterbodies in each HUC12. Dissolved the merged waterbodies feature class. Intersected it with NHDPlusV2_WBDSnapshot_EnviroAtlas_CONUS. Calculated the area in square kilometers for each feature in the intersection. Summarized on the HUC_12 field, with the sum of square kilometers as a summary statistic. Change any nulls to zero. The output is a table with the total waterbody area for each HUC12.

2.d. Find the total stream length for each HUC12. First, remove flowlines that do not represent streams or rivers. Add a field for feature type (FTYPE) names to the merged NHD flowlines; use the table from the help file at http://nhd.usgs.gov/userGuide/Robohelpfiles/NHD_User_Guide/Feature_Catalog/Hydrography_Dataset/Complete_FCode_List.htm to add feature types based on FCODE. Do the same for the merged NHDArea feature class. Add a second field to the flowlines, AreaFCODE. Join the merged NHDArea feature class to the flowlines using the Permanent_Identifier from NHDArea and WBArea_Permanent_Identifier from NHDFlowlines. Copy the FCODE from NHDArea to AreaFCODE in the flowlines. Delete all flowlines with feature type 'COASTLINE,' 'PIPELINE,' or 'UNDERGROUND CONDUIT;' also delete ARTIFICIAL PATH features if AreaFCODE does not equal 'STREAM/RIVER.' The remaining reaches are of FTYPE STREAM/RIVER, CANAL/DITCH, CONNECTOR, or ARTIFICIAL PATH, where ARTIFICIAL PATH represents STREAM/RIVER areas. Intersect the remaining flowlines with the 12-digit HUCs, then dissolve the output on the HUC_12 field. Calculate length in kilometers.
2.e. Calculate stream density. Calculate the areas of the 12-digit HUCs in square kilometers, join them to the flowlines, and divide stream length by HUC12 area to find stream density.

3. Get the total length of streams with any 303(d) impairment. Intersect rad_303d_l with the 12-digit HUCs, dissolve the output on HUC_12, and calculate the flowline length in kilometers for each HUC12.
4. Join outputs and export to Impaired_Waters_2016.

cntorgp.cntorg: U.S. Environmental Protection Agency, Office of Research and Development-Sustainable and Healthy Communities Research Program, EnviroAtlas

metainfo.metstdn: FGDC Content Standard for Digital Geospatial Metadata

cntorgp.cntorg: U.S. Environmental Protection Agency, Office of Research and Development-Sustainable and Healthy Communities Research Program, EnviroAtlas

enttyp.enttypd: Lengths of streams with listed 303(d) impairements, with stream length, stream density, and waterbody area.

attr.attrdef: Twelve Digit Hydrologic Unit Code. This field provides a unique 12-digit code for each subwatershed. Numbers were assigned in an upstream to downstream fashion. Where no downstream/upstream relationship could be determined, numbers were assigned in a clockwise fashion.
attr.attrdefs: Federal Guidelines, Requirements, and Procedures for the National Watershed Boundary Dataset; Chapter 3 of Section A; Federal Standards, Book 11, Collection and Delineation of Spatial Data; Techniques and Methods 11-A3.

attr.attrdef: Total area of all waterbodies (square kilometers), from the high-resolution NHDWaterbody dataset.
The total length (km) of streams, rivers, canals, and connectors from the high-resolution NHDFlowlines.
The length of streams per 12-digit HUC in km, divided by the area in square km.
Total stream length (km) with 303(d) impairments "Cause Unknown - Impaired Biota," "Cause Unknown - Fish Kills," or "Fish Consumption Advisory."
Total stream length (km) with 303(d) impairment "Metals (other than mercury)."
Total stream length (km) with 303(d) impairments "Algal growth," "Noxious aquatic plants," "Nuisance exotic species," and "Nuisance native species."
Total stream length (km) with 303(d) impairment "Organic enrichment/Oxygen depletion."
Total stream length (km) with 303(d) impairment "pH/acidity/caustic conditions."
Total stream length (km) with 303(d) impairments "Sediment" or "Turbidity."

Total stream length (km) with 303(d) impairments "cause unknown," "other cause," "flow alteration(s)," "habitat alterations," "ammonia," "biotoxins," "chlorine," "dioxins," "oil and grease," "polychlorinated biphenyls (pcbs)," "radiation," "salinity/total dissolved solids/chlorides/sulfates," "taste, color, and odor," "total toxics," "toxic inorganics," "toxic organics," or "trash."
Total stream length (km) with any listed 303(d) impairment.
